intro: Palala cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved palala, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically arranged in a rosette pattern, and it thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Palala cuspidata is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
